critique: The document establishes a temporary organization (PASO) within the Department of State to support the governments of Afghanistan and Pakistan. It aims to strengthen these governments, enhance their capacity to resist extremists, and maintain a U.S. diplomatic presence. The order outlines the functions of PASO, including supporting efforts to enhance civilian control and stable constitutional government in Pakistan, promoting a more capable and effective government in Afghanistan, and stimulating economic opportunity. It also addresses personnel and administrative matters, general provisions, and the termination of PASO.
